definition: V or v is the twenty-second letter of the English alphabet
for versus

senses.definition: ' A vacancy in a hotel or guest house is a room which is available to be occupied.
example: The factory has a vacancy for a skilled fitter. [j33] I am afraid there are no vacancies in the sales department at the moment
NO VACANCIES [j33] The only vacancy we have is a room on the second floor

senses.definition: ' A vacancy in a hotel or guest house is a room which is available to be occupied.
example: The factory has a vacancy for a skilled fitter. [j33] I am afraid there are no vacancies in the sales department at the moment
NO VACANCIES [j33] The only vacancy we have is a room on the second floor

senses.definition: ' If a house or unit, or a room in a hotel is vacant, nobody is living or staying there.
example: Is this seat vacant? [j33] When you lock the toilet, the sign outside changes from VACANT to ENGAGED. [j33] None of the phone boxes was vacant
The position of marketing manager is vacant at the moment
The house is vacant at the moment but tenants will be moving in next week
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vacate' Guests should vacate the room by noon on the day of departure.

senses.definition: ' A vacation is a part of the year when schools and colleges are closed.
example: I'm planning to take a vacation in Bali. [j33] I don't want to think about that now[j4]I'm on vacation
I took a Christmas job during the summer vacation

definition: A vaccine is a substance which is made from the germs of a particular disease
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb vaccinate' Have you been vaccinated against polio?[j35]'noun vaccination' I need to get some vaccinations before my trip.
example: It is injected into people in small doses to prevent them from getting the disease

senses.definition: ' If you vacuum the floor or carpet, you clean it by using a vacuum cleaner.
example: ' A vacuum or vacuum cleaner is an electrical ~appliance which sucks up dust and dirt from floors and carpets
I just want to vacuum the lounge room before the guests arrive. [j33] If there's one chore I really hate, it's vacuuming

definition: [j24]A woman's vagina is the passage that leads from the outside of her body to the uterus
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective vaginal'
example: In sexual intercourse the man puts his penis into the woman's vagina

senses.definition: ' If someone is vague, they do not have things clearly fixed in their mind.
example: We could see only vague shapes in the fog. [j33] The details of the trip are still fairly vague
Meng couldn't get any sense out of the woman[j4] she was quite vague. [j33] He's hopelessly vague[j4]his wife has to organise everything for him
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vaguely' The man seemed vaguely familiar.  It tastes vaguely of onion.[j35]'noun vagueness'

senses.definition: ' in vain'  In formal language, if you say something is in vain, you mean it is not successful.
example: Celine's the vainest girl I've ever met[j4] she spends hours admiring herself in the mirror
All our efforts to cheer him up were in vain. [j33] They battled in vain to extinguish the blaze
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun See vanity'.

senses.definition: ' If something such as an argument or conclusion is valid, it is based on sound reasoning.
example: The passport is not valid[j4]it expired last month. [j33] This offer is valid for the next three months
They have no valid objection to the proposal
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun validity'

definition: A valley is a piece of low land between two hills or mountains

senses.definition: ' If something such as help or advice is valuable, it is useful.
example: She owns a lot of valuable jewellery

senses.definition: ' values'  Your values are your moral principles and your beliefs about what is important in society.
example: This wine is really good value at $10. [j33] You usually get better value by buying the larger size. [j33] I've certainly got good value out of this coat[j4]I've worn it every day this winter

definition: A valve is a device which opens and shuts to control the flow of a liquid or gas.
example: One of the valves in his heart had become blocked

definition: A van is a fairly small vehicle used for carrying goods
A vandal is someone who deliberately destroys or damages other people's property.
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY 'verb vandalise (<or> vandalize)' The shed had been vandalised.[j35]'noun vandalism'
example: The windows of the disused factory were broken by vandals. [j33] Some vandals cut my grand~ mother's garden hose in half

definition: Vanilla is a food flavouring
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective vanilla' ...vanilla ice- cream.  ...vanilla essence.
example: It can be extracted from the pod of a tropical plant, or created artificially

definition: If something vanishes, it disappears.  It is no longer visible.
rest: My sci:ss@rs wErE hErE a: mi:nu:tE a:g@, bu:t n@w thEy'vE va:ni:shEd!
example: The ship vanished over the horizon. [j33] Rub the lotion into your skin until it vanishes

definition: Vanity is the quality of being vain, or too proud of your appearance, intelligence or ability.
example: The defeat was a blow to his vanity

definition: Vapour is made up of tiny particles of liquid in the air, such as steam, mist or fog

senses.definition: ' A variety of something is a particular kind or sort.
senses.rest: Whi:ch va:ri:Ety @f bEEr i:s i:t[j4]F@stErs, VB @r T@@hEys?
example: The shop has a large variety of clothes. [j33] I'd like a job with more variety

senses.definition: ' many and various'  If you say things are many and various, you mean that there are a lot of different ones.  Note that '
example: I've still got various matters to sort out. [j33] There were various pieces of equipment in the room. [j33] I asked various colleagues, but nobody knew anything about it
various is not used after the noun it describes except in this phrase.  [cf2]John's got some flaws, but his good points are many and various

definition: Varnish is a clear liquid which is used as a finish on wood or woodwork to give a hard shiny surface when it dries
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb varnish'

senses.definition: ' If you vary something, you change it.
example: The temperature never varies very much. [j33] Her moods vary a lot. [j33] ~ Prices vary[j4]it's worth shopping around
I decided to vary my routine and walk to work. [j33] You can vary this dish by using different vegetables
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun See variety'.[j35]'adjective See various'.[j35]'adjective variable' The weather has been very variable this week.[j35]'noun variation' He sticks to the same routine without variation.

example: The temperature never varies very much. [j33] Her moods vary a lot. [j33] ~ Prices vary[j4]it's worth shopping around
I decided to vary my routine and walk to work. [j33] You can vary this dish by using different vegetables
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun See variety'.[j35]'adjective See various'.[j35]'adjective variable' The weather has been very variable this week.[j35]'noun variation' He sticks to the same routine without variation.

definition: A vase is a container used to hold and display flowers
example: Vases are usually made of china or glass

definition: If something is vast, it is very large indeed.  It is huge or enormous.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vastly' This one is vastly superior.  It would be vastly preferable to wait.
example: Australia is a vast continent. [j33] There is a vast difference between the two brothers[j4]one so generous and the other totally selfish. [j33] She makes a vast amount of money

definition: A vat is a large container like a barrel used for storing liquids such as beer and whisky
A VCR is a video cassette recorder
note: ... SEE video.

definition: A VDU is the screen of a computer where the information is displayed
note: ... NOTE This is an abbreviation from the words 'visual display unit.

definition: Veal is meat from a calf
A vegan is someone who doesn't eat or use any products that come from animals
A vegetable is a plant or part of a plant which you eat as part of a savoury dish
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective vegetable' ...vegetable soup.  ...vegetable bake.
example: Potatoes, carrots, peas, beans, cabbage, broccoli and pumpkin are a few of the most common vegetables that people eat in Australia

definition: A vegetarian is someone who doesn't eat meat
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective vegetarian' ...a vegetarian diet.  ...a vegetarian restaurant.  ...a vegetarian cookbook.
example: Some vegetarians also don't eat fish or any products that come from animals

definition: Vegetation refers to plants in general.
example: The bushfires destroyed most of the vegetation in the area

definition: <noun> Vegie' is an informal word for vegetable'
If someone is vehement about something, they express very strong feelings about it.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vehemence' They were surprised  by the vehemence of the protests.[j35]'adverb vehemently' He argued vehemently in favour of keeping the factory open.
example: Luke was vehement in his opposition to the plan. [j33] The proposal encountered vehement resistance

definition: A vehicle is a form of transport, especially one that travels on the road such as a car, van or bus.
example: He swerved to avoid an oncoming vehicle. [j33] A dozen vehicles were involved in the smash. [j33] The class of driver's licence you have shows what types of vehicles you are allowed to drive

senses.definition: ' If you veil something, you hide or disguise it.
example: We put up wall hangings to veil the damp patches in the plaster. [j33] The report contained thinly veiled criticisms of the previous management

senses.definition: ' If you veil something, you hide or disguise it.
example: We put up wall hangings to veil the damp patches in the plaster. [j33] The report contained thinly veiled criticisms of the previous management

senses.definition: ' A vein is a blood vessel that carries blood from some part of your body back to your heart so that it can receive more oxygen. A blood vessel that carries blood from your heart out to some part of your body is called an artery. 2 ' '
example: noun The thin lines on a leaf which carry sap are also called veins

definition: Velvet is a fabric which has a short thick smooth pile like a carpet, so that it feels very rich to the touch
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective velvety' The leaf was covered in velvety down.   The mousse has a velvety consistency.
example: It can be made of cotton, nylon or silk thread

senses.definition: ' If a piece of furniture is made of veneer, it has a thin layer of fine wood glued onto the outside of cheap wood or chipboard. 2 ' '
example: noun A veneer is a thin layer or coating on something.  [cf2]The veneer is chipping off the kitchen units. [j33] Beneath his veneer of good manners he has a violent temper
note: [j34] ... WORD FAMILY 'verb veneer' The cabinet is veneered with oak.

definition: A [chvenereal disease is a disease which is passed from one person to another by sexual intercourse, for example AIDS, syphilis and gonorrhoea
note: ... ANOTHER WORD for this is sexually transmitted disease or STD.

senses.definition: ' In formal language, vengeance is another word for revenge.    '[cf3]2 with a vengeance  ' '
example: If you do something with a ven~ geance, you do it with great energy and often much more than was expected or necessary.    [cf2]After his wife died he threw himself into his work with a vengeance. [j33] At first it was just a shower, but soon it began to rain with a vengeance

senses.definition: ' Venom is intense bitterness of feeling.
example: An antidote to the venom of the taipan was developed in 1955
She spoke of his betrayal with venom
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective venomous' Australia's most venomous spiders are the redback and the funnelweb.

senses.definition: ' Venom is intense bitterness of feeling.
example: An antidote to the venom of the taipan was developed in 1955
She spoke of his betrayal with venom
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective venomous' Australia's most venomous spiders are the redback and the funnelweb.

definition: If you ventilate a room, you bring in fresh air, usually by opening a window
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun ventilation' The room is very stuffy because of poor ventilation.

senses.definition: ' In rather formal language, if you say you venture to do something, you mean that you do it although you aren't sure what the reaction will be.
example: Andrea is trying to raise capital for a new business venture. [j33] Moving to Australia was quite a venture, but I've never regretted it
I was pleasantly surprised when at last I ventured into town

I was so overawed by the company that it was a while before I ventured to speak. [j33] Might I venture to suggest you do it this way? [j33] I hardly dared to venture an opinion.  ~--venue 'times,0'[cp8.5][j24]venju' '[cf2]noun The venue for a public event is the place where it is held.    [cf2]The town is short of venues for rock concerts. [j33] They are building a major new sporting venue on the former factory site

definition: A veranda is an area joining onto the outside of a house, with a roof over it but usually without walls.  Verandas are usually on the ground floor of a house.
note: ... ANOTHER SPELLING for this is verandah.  [j32] ... SEE THE PICTURE at house'.  [j32] ... A SIMILAR WORD is balcony'.
example: It was so hot we all slept on the veranda last night

definition: In grammar, a verb is a word that refers to an action as opposed to a thing
example: It describes what happens or what somebody does

senses.definition: ' Sometimes verbal refers to spoken rather than written language.
example: Sam's verbal skills are improving
I've only had a verbal answer to my letter
note: ... ANOTHER WORD for this is oral.   3' 'adjective In grammar, verbal means relating to verbs.  ...a verbal noun.  ...a verbal use of the word.

senses.definition: ' Sometimes verbal refers to spoken rather than written language.
example: Sam's verbal skills are improving
I've only had a verbal answer to my letter
note: ... ANOTHER WORD for this is oral.   3' 'adjective In grammar, verbal means relating to verbs.  ...a verbal noun.  ...a verbal use of the word.

senses.definition: ' A verdict can also be a judgment or decision that is made in any circumstances.
example: The jury brought in a verdict of guilty
Well, I'll tell you my verdict[j4] I think he shouldn't have walked out in the first place. [j33] What's the verdict?  Should I add more pepper? [j33] I'm waiting for the examiner's verdict

senses.definition: ' A verdict can also be a judgment or decision that is made in any circumstances.
example: The jury brought in a verdict of guilty
Well, I'll tell you my verdict[j4] I think he shouldn't have walked out in the first place. [j33] What's the verdict?  Should I add more pepper? [j33] I'm waiting for the examiner's verdict

definition: In rather formal language, if you say you verify something, you mean that you confirm that it is true.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun verification'
example: I've heard the rumours but I've been unable to verify them. [j33] Can you verify that Alex will be a trustworthy tenant? [j33] This just verifies what I've been saying all along

senses.definition: ' If something such as ~a machine or piece of equipment is versatile, it can be used in many different ways or for different purposes.
example: These days workers have to be versatile as technology changes so rapidly. [j33] She is an amazingly versatile artist, working in three dimensions as well as oils and watercolours
This ladder is very versatile[j4]it can be extended to various lengths or folded into a step ladder
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun versatility'

This ladder is very versatile[j4]it can be extended to various lengths or folded into a step ladder
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun versatility'

senses.definition: ' A verse is also the shortest division of a holy book such as the Bible or Koran.
example: She started to sing 'Waltzing Matilda', but forgot the words after the first verse. [j33] The soloist sang the verses, and we all joined in with the chorus
She quoted from Luke, chapter 3, verse 5: Every mountain and hill shall be brought low

definition: A version of something is a form of it which is different in some details to other ones.  One thing is transformed by some process into different versions.
example: I've made some corrections to the first version of the report. [j33] I've seen the movie, but not the stage version of it. [j33] The witnesses all gave different versions of what had happened

definition: Versus means 'against'. It is used mostly in talking about the two teams that play against each other in a sports match.
note: ... NOTE This is often abbreviated as v or vs.
example: It looks as though it'll be Australia versus Japan in the final

definition: Your vertebrae are the bones of your spine or backbone

senses.definition: ' If something is vertical, it is standing up straight.
example: ...a vertical line
The wire is suspended between vertical poles. [j33] I was so tired it was all I could do to remain vertical
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is horizontal.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vertically'

senses.definition: ' If something is vertical, it is standing up straight.
example: ...a vertical line
The wire is suspended between vertical poles. [j33] I was so tired it was all I could do to remain vertical
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is horizontal.  [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vertically'

senses.definition: ' You use very to emphasise the adjective or adverb that follows.
example: It's very hot today. [j33] Her unit is very small. [j33] I've very nearly finished. [j33] I don't come here very often. [j33] I enjoyed it very much indeed. [j33] He came the very next day. ~ 2 ' '[cf2]adjective If you say something is the very one, you mean that it is the exact one.  [cf2]This is the very place where John proposed to me. [j33] The first book I took off the shelf was the very one I was looking for

senses.definition: ' blood vessel' A blood vessel is an artery or vein through which blood circulates around the body.
example: They sailed down the east coast of Australia in a small fishing vessel
The incense was carried in two golden vessels
He was so angry that I thought he was going to burst a blood vessel

example: They sailed down the east coast of Australia in a small fishing vessel
The incense was carried in two golden vessels

senses.definition: ' If you vet someone or something for a particular purpose, you check very carefully to make sure they are suitable and acceptable.
example: This word is a shortened form of the formal term veterinary surgeon
You have to be vetted before getting a job in the security services. [j33] My mother wants to meet my new girlfriend so she can vet her. [j33] It's impossible to vet everything the kids read

senses.definition: ' If you vet someone or something for a particular purpose, you check very carefully to make sure they are suitable and acceptable.
example: This word is a shortened form of the formal term veterinary surgeon
You have to be vetted before getting a job in the security services. [j33] My mother wants to meet my new girlfriend so she can vet her. [j33] It's impossible to vet everything the kids read

definition: If someone vetoes something, they use their authority to prevent it from happening.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun veto (vetoes)' I didn't dare to defy his veto.
example: We all wanted to put up Christmas decorations in the canteen, but the boss vetoed the idea. [j33] My mother has vetoed wet towels inside the house

definition: If something vexes you, it makes you cross, worried or puzzled.
example: I was vexed by his refusal. [j33] It vexes me to see you so unhappy. [j33] The problem has vexed researchers for decades

definition: Via means 'by way of'.  You use it to say that you go through a place while you are travelling.
example: He went from Sydney to Mel~ bourne via Yass. [j33] There are daily flights to Europe via Bangkok or Singapore

definition: If something vibrates, it shakes or trembles rapidly.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vibration'
example: I could feel the washing machine vibrating. [j33] The force of the blast made the windows vibrate

definition: .  for '
example: Victoria

senses.definition: ' A vice is also a device that you use to hold something firmly while you are working on it.
example: His main vice is that he tends to be rather self-obsessed
She clamped the piece of wood into a vice
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is virtue.   b' 'noun A vice is something bad that someone enjoys.  This word is often used in a humorous way.  I eat far too much chocolate, but it's my only vice.

senses.definition: ' A vice is also a device that you use to hold something firmly while you are working on it.
example: His main vice is that he tends to be rather self-obsessed
She clamped the piece of wood into a vice
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is virtue.   b' 'noun A vice is something bad that someone enjoys.  This word is often used in a humorous way.  I eat far too much chocolate, but it's my only vice.

definition: If you say something and then say vice versa, you mean that what you say is also true the other way round.
example: Agnes loathes Belinda and vice versa. [j33] She plays tennis on Mondays and netball on Tuesdays[j4]or vice versa, I can't remember

definition: In rather formal language, if you say something is in the vicinity of something else, you mean that it is near or close by.
example: I'm not sure exactly where the florist is, but it's in the vicinity of the post office. [j33] Excuse me, is there a phone box in the vicinity? [j33] The cost will be in the vicinity of $500

definition: If someone or something is vicious, they are savage or cruel.
example: Don't go into number 14[j4]they've got a vicious dog. [j33] The whole town was outraged by the vicious murder. [j33] She's got a vicious temper. [j33] The rumour is a vicious lie

definition: A victim is someone who suffers an accident or a crime.
example: Bystanders rushed to pull the victims from the car. [j33] The victim was taken to hospital with stab wounds

definition: If someone is victim~ ised, they are singled out to be treated badly.
note: [j32] ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective victorious'
example: He claimed that he was being victimised because of his colour. senses.definition: ' A video is a machine which records television programs onto tapes and plays back these and other recordings through a television set.
example: Don't forget to set the video before you go to bed
note: ... ANOTHER TERM for this is video cassette recorder or VCR.   2' 'noun A video or video cassette is a tape containing recorded images and sound which can be played back through a television set.  I don't feel like going out[j4]let's just get a takeaway and a video.   ... WORD FAMILY 'verb video' Let's video the game and then we can watch it when we get home.

definition: Videotape is mag~ netic tape used for recording film and television pictures and sound.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb videotape' Did you videotape the Sunday night movie?
example: These days most productions are shot on videotape rather than film. [j33] They showed a videotape of the incident

senses.definition: ' in view of'  You use in view of to give the circumstances which explain why something happens.
example: The unit has marvellous views of the city. [j33] The electricity cables spoil the view. [j33] The boat disappeared from view
We must take everyone's view into consid~ eration. [j33] My view is that it's too expensive
In view of the fact that he made a full apology, Anna decided to forgive him. [j33] We decided to postpone the picnic in view of the bad weather

example: Several viewers com~ ~plained about the violence. [j33] The show attracted over 400 000 viewers

senses.definition: ' A vigorous action is done forcefully with a lot of energy.
example: Carlos is amazingly vigorous for a man of 70[j4]he still plays tennis twice a week with his son. [j33] A vigorous growth of ivy covered the walls
He greeted me with a vigorous shake of my hand
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vigour'

senses.definition: ' In formal language, if you say something is vile, you mean that it is wicked or evil.
example: The walls are painted a vile green. [j33] What on earth is that vile smell? [j33] She served us some sort of vile fish stew
The perpetrators of this vile crime must be brought to justice. [j33] This allegation is a vile slander on her good name

definition: A village is a small town, usually in the country

senses.definition: ' In informal language, you can call someone a villain if they are always getting up to mischief.
example: He is a notorious villain and gang leader. [j33] At the end of the movie the hero shoots the villain. [j33] I'm being made out to be the villain
Raoul is a real little villain[j4]he keeps pinching the chocolate biscuits. [j33] Some villain has left the cap off the toothpaste again

definition: If someone is vindictive, they are spiteful and try to harm people that they think have treated them badly.
example: Don't cross Antoine[j4]he's a very vindictive person. [j33] It's time to forgive and forget and not be vindictive

senses.definition: ' A vine is a climbing plant with a woody stem, such as the ones on which grapes grow
example: ' A vine is also a creeping plant, such as the ones on which pumpkins or melons grow

example: ' A vine is also a creeping plant, such as the ones on which pumpkins or melons grow

definition: Vinegar is a sour liquid made from wine or cider
example: It is used to flavour food and is an ingredient of salad dressings and sauces

senses.definition: ' If you describe something as vintage, you mean that it is a typical or very good example of its kind, dating from some time ago.
example: Do you remember when he turned up in his pyjamas? That's vintage Desmond! [j33] They're showing a season of vintage thrillers
' A vintage car is an old car of a type that isn't made any more which people buy and restore as a hobby

definition: Vinyl is a type of strong flexible plastic
example: It is used as a floor covering and as upholstery

senses.definition: ' If something such as a storm or an explosion is violent, it has great force and is very destructive.
example: He was abusive, and I was afraid that he might become violent. [j33] It is a very violent neighbourhood. [j33] I don't like my kids to watch such violent videos
Violent waves dashed against the rock
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun violence' The protest ended in rioting and violence.[j35]'adverb violently' He disagreed violently.  The storm raged violently all night.

definition: A violin is a stringed musical instrument which you play with a bow
A VIP is a celebrity or someone who is treated especially well because of their status.  This word is an abbreviation of '
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective VIP' She was escorted into the VIP lounge.   He refused to be given VIP treatment.
example: very important person.  [cf2]The premier and the other VIPs took their seats in the front row. [j33] As guests of the managing director, we were treated as VIPs

senses.definition: ' If something such as land or forest is described as virgin, it is in its original natural state.  It has not been cultivated or spoilt by humans.
example: There are 4000 acres of virgin bush in Tasmania
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun virginity' She lost her virginity at the age of 16.

senses.definition: ' If something such as land or forest is described as virgin, it is in its original natural state.  It has not been cultivated or spoilt by humans.
example: There are 4000 acres of virgin bush in Tasmania
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun virginity' She lost her virginity at the age of 16.

definition: If a man is virile, he is physically strong and characteristically masculine in his appearance and behaviour

senses.definition: a' A virtue is a good aspect of someone's character.
example: Salim is very generous[j4] that's just one of his many virtues
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is vice.   b' 'noun A virtue is a welcome or useful feature of something.  One of the virtues of this dish is that it's quick to prepare.  2 ' 'noun In formal language, virtue is the quality of being morally good.  They believed that virtue would be rewarded in the afterlife.   ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective virtuous'

definition: If something such as a disease or poison is virulent, it is very powerful and deadly.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective viral' ...a viral infection.
example: This is a particularly virulent strain of the bacteria

senses.definition: a' A virus is an extremely small organism which causes disease.
example: Doctors have succeeded in isolating the virus responsible for the outbreak
' A virus is also a computer program that has been especially written to cause damage or annoyance if it is loaded onto a computer along with other programs or data

definition: A visa is a stamp or document which shows that you have official permission to visit a particular country and remain there for a certain length of time.
example: You'll need a visa to go to New Caledonia. [j33] My visa expires at the end of the year

definition: If something is visible, it can be seen.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun visibility' Visibility was reduced to a few metres in the fog.[j35]'adverb visibly' She was visibly moved by the occasion.
example: The boat was just visible on the horizon. [j33] The germs are not visible to the naked eye. [j33] The stain is hardly visible. [j33] There was a visible improvement in his health

senses.definition: ' Vision is the ability to imagine clearly how things ought to be and how to bring that situation about.
example: My vision has deteriorated lately[j4]I ought to go to the optician
He ~saw a vision of the Virgin Mary. [j33] She had a vision of a terrible fire engulfing the house
Jack's an idealist[j4]he has a vision of a perfect world. [j33] I had visions of Bharati falling off her bike from the day that we gave it to her
Governor Macquarie was a man of vision. He was concerned for the future of the colony of New South Wales

definition: If you visit a person or a place, you go to see them, usually for a fairly short time.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun visit' Lucy's here on a visit for a few days.   I asked the doctor to pay a home visit.[j35]'adjective visitor' He rose to welcome his visitor.  I can put visitors up on the sofa bed.
example: Carmen visits her mother every Sunday. [j33] We must visit Bondi before we leave Sydney. [j33] I've never visited Europe

definition: Visual means relating to seeing.
example: Will you be using any visual aids during your lecture? [j33] She has a strong visual sense and finds it easy to interpret plans and diagrams

definition: A visual display unit is a computer terminal which presents information on a screen
note: ... A SHORTENED FORM of this word is VDU.

definition: If you visualise some~ thing, you picture it to yourself in your mind.  You imagine what it looks like or how it is.
note: ... ANOTHER SPELLING of this word is visualize.
example: I haven't seen the house, but I can visualise it from your description. [j33] It is hard to visualise a society in which all routine work is done by robots

definition: If something is vital, it is necessary and extremely important.  It is essential.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vitally' Exercise is vitally important.
example: If you want to lose weight, exercise is vital. [j33] It is vital that everyone should be aware of the emergency evacuation procedure

definition: If someone is full of vitality, they are very active and energetic.
example: She positively glows with health and vitality

definition: 'times,0'[cp8.5][j24]va[j11]t[j17]m[j17]n, [j24]v[j11]t-' Vitamins are substances found in some foods.  People and animals ~need certain amounts of particular vitamins in order to remain healthy.  You can also buy pills containing vitamins in case you are not getting enough in your diet.
example: Vitamin A helps you to see in the dark

definition: If someone is vivacious, they have a very lively personality.
example: Michael's new girlfriend is a vivacious brunette

senses.definition: ' If something such as a description is vivid, it is clear and lively.  It makes you able to imagine the thing very well.
example: He uses vivid blues and greens in his paintings
Angelo told his story in vivid detail
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adverb vividly'

senses.definition: ' Your vocabulary is all the words that you know or use in a language.
example: Lisa has a very wide vocabulary for her age. [j33] Reading widely will help to increase your vocabulary

senses.definition: ' If someone is vocal, they are insistent on making their views known.
example: The young Italian soprano is famous for her large vocal range
The debate has been dominated by a small group of vocal protestors
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun See vocalist'.

definition: A vocalist is a singer, especially one who performs with a band
A vogue is a fashion for something such as a particular style of clothing or type of music.
example: The present vogue is for short skirts. [j33] It's impossible to keep up with every passing vogue. [j33] Marianne is obsessed with being in vogue

senses.definition: ' If you have a voice in a decision, you have a say in it.  Your opinion is taken into consideration.
example: She's got a lovely voice. [j33] I didn't recognise his voice. [j33] He spoke in a soft voice. [j33] I heard voices in the corridor. [j33] Ann's got a cold[j4]she's lost her voice
They complained that they had had no voice in the debate
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb voice' Lynn voiced her concern at the proposal.

senses.definition: ' In rather literary language, a void is an empty space.
example: The contract was void because it had not been properly drawn up
The spacecraft hurtled into the black void. [j33] Theresa felt a terrible void in her life after her husband died

The spacecraft hurtled into the black void. [j33] Theresa felt a terrible void in her life after her husband died

definition: A volcano is a moun~ tain formed from rock which has erupted in molten form through a crack in the earth's surface
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective volcanic'
example: If it is an active volcano, it is likely to erupt again and send lava, gases, steam and ash into the sky

senses.definition: ' A volley of shots is several of them fired at the same time or in quick succession
example: ' In tennis, if you play a volley, you hit the ball back to the other player without letting it bounce first
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb volley' She surprised her opponent by volleying.

senses.definition: ' A volley of shots is several of them fired at the same time or in quick succession
example: ' In tennis, if you play a volley, you hit the ball back to the other player without letting it bounce first
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'verb volley' She surprised her opponent by volleying.

definition: Volleyball is a game played between two teams
example: It involves hitting a large ball over a high net with your hands and not allowing it to touch the ground

senses.definition: ' A volume is a book, especially a large one which forms part of a series.
example: Volume is measured in cubic units
He never expected such a large volume of work. [j33] We have received a large volume of enquiries
I asked him to turn down the volume of his radio. [j33] You can adjust the volume with this knob, and the tuning with this one
The encyclopedia consists of sixteen volumes. [j33] The price is $50 per volume, or $175 for the set of four

senses.definition: ' If something is voluntary, you do not have to do it.  You can do it if you want to.
example: Contributions are supposed to be voluntary, but many people feel pressured into paying. 2 ' '[cf2]adjective If you do voluntary work, you are not paid for it.  You give your time to help a charity or a community organisation.  [cf2]Myra does a lot of voluntary work at the local hospital
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun See volunteer'.[j35]'adverb voluntarily' They handed in their guns voluntarily.

senses.definition: ' A volunteer is also someone who joins the armed forces because they want to and not because they are forced to do so by law. 3 ' '
example: Charities can't survive without the help of volunteers. [j33] The hospital is seeking volunteers for its medical research
verb If you volunteer to do something, you offer to do it without being forced to do it.  [cf2]Adele's always willing to help[j4]she volunteered to do the washing up
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'adjective volunteer' ...volunteer work.

definition: If you vomit, you throw up food from your stomach out through your mouth.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vomit' I avoided stepping in the pool of vomit.
example: I ate a bad oyster and I couldn't stop vomiting

definition: If you vote, you register your support for a particular person or plan by marking your choice on a piece of paper or by raising your hand at a meeting.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vote' Let's take a vote.  Each person has one vote.[j35]'noun voter'
example: In Australia all citizens must vote at elections. [j33] Who are you going to vote for? [j33] I've voted Labor all my life. [j33] The workers voted to strike. [j33] I vote we try one more time

definition: A voucher is a specially printed piece of paper that is worth a certain amount of money when you use it to buy something.
note: ... WORD FAMILY 'noun vow' He broke his solemn vow.
example: I received a book voucher worth $75 for my birthday. [j33] This voucher entitles you to $10 off any three-course meal. [j33] Present this voucher to receive free admission.  ~--vow 'times,0'[cp8.5]va[j23]' '[cf2]verb If you vow to do something, you promise to do it.  You form and usually express a firm intention to do it.  [cf2]He vowed to be avenged. [j33] How many times has she vowed to stop drinking? [j33] I vowed never to go there again after the poor service we received

senses.definition: ' A vowel is a sound in a language which you make with your mouth open. A sequence of two vowels is called a  diphthong. 2 ' '
example: noun A vowel is a letter of the alphabet used to represent these sounds.  In English the letters a, e, i, o, u and sometimes y are vowels
note: ... THE OPPOSITE of this is consonant.

definition: A voyage is a long journey that you make by sea or air.

definition: 'times,0'[cp8.5][j24]v... lnr[j17]b[j17]l, -n[j17]r[j17]b[j17]l' If someone is vulnerable, they are likely to suffer something unpleasant because they are in a weak position.
